content:
#93313 causes us to accept more programs by allowing CFG analysis to rely on on visible uninhabitedness of a type (taking #[non_exhaustive] into account). See this test

Personally I think this looks right, but I'm not sure I should be making that call. Is this the type of thing you want escalated to t-lang?
In general, yes, I think we should evaluate cases where we accept more programs than we used to, to make sure we went to commit to that behavior.
This behaviour was originally introduced in #54125, but regressed between 1.37 and 1.38.

tmandry said:

Is this the type of thing you want escalated to t-lang?

In general, any change that would cause hard errors in stable code if reverted needs an FCP.
